## Buachaille Etive Mòr Hike: Stob Dearg & Stob na Bròige

Join us for an unforgettable summer hike in **Glen Etive** as we take on one or both of the spectacular Munros that form **Buachaille Etive Mòr** — **Stob Dearg (1,022 m / 3,353 ft)** and **Stob na Bròige (956 m / 3,136 ft)**.

This iconic ridge walk offers breathtaking panoramic views over **Glencoe**, **Rannoch Moor**, and the **Etive Valley** — a must-do for any Scottish hillwalker.

---

## 🗓️ Date  
**Saturday, 16 August 2025**

## 📍 Location  
**Meeting Point:** Usher Hall, Edinburgh  
**Departure Time:** 05:00 AM sharp  
*Note: An early start is essential due to the travel distance and hike duration.*

---

## 🥾 Hike Overview

- **Distance:** ~13–15 km (depending on whether one or both Munros are summited)  
- **Elevation Gain:** ~1,000 metres  
- **Difficulty:** Strenuous  
- **Duration:** 6–8 hours (including breaks)  
- **Terrain:** Rocky paths, steep ascents, exposed ridge walking

Participants may choose to:

- Climb **Stob Dearg** only (the main summit)  
- Continue along the ridge to include **Stob na Bròige**  
- Or, if you’ve already done **Stob Dearg**, focus on **Stob na Bròige** this time

---

## 🎒 What to Bring

- Sturdy hiking boots  
- Waterproof and windproof outerwear  
- Hat, gloves, and warm layers  
- Packed lunch and high-energy snacks  
- At least 2 litres of water  
- Walking poles (optional but recommended)  
- Sunscreen and midge repellent  

---

## 🚗 Travel

Carpooling may be arranged. Please let us know early if you can offer or need a lift when registering. **Avoid last-minute cancellations**, especially if you’re part of a shared transport arrangement, as it affects planning.  
Fuel and parking costs will be shared among passengers.
